content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Block Count & Layers:
The structure consists of 8 blocks total, arranged in 2 primary layers:
- Front/bottom layer: 2 red arch blocks
- Upper/back layer: 2 yellow half-cylinders, 2 tall yellow rectangular blocks, and 2 green rectangular blocks

## Spatial Relationships:
- Two red arch blocks form the base at the front
- Two yellow half-cylinders sit on top of the red arch blocks
- Two green rectangular blocks stand vertically behind the structure
- Two tall yellow rectangular blocks stand at the back

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks:
- 2× Block #1 (red arch block, left orientation)
- 2× Block #14 (yellow half-cylinder)
- 2× Block #11 (tall yellow rectangular block)
- 2× Block #8 (tall green rectangular block)

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 1
   Step3: Move block with index 14
   Step4: Move block with index 14
   Step5: Move block with index 8
   Step6: Move block with index 8
   Step7: Move block with index 11
   Step8: Move block with index 11
}
```

This assembly sequence first places the red arches as the foundation, then adds the yellow half-cylinders on top, followed by the green vertical blocks behind them, and finally the tall yellow blocks at the back to complete the structure.
